intro: Ecbolium refractifolium, commonly known as the refractive leaf ecbolium, is a rare flowering plant characterized by its unique translucent foliage. Its leaves are thin and waxy, allowing light to pass through them, which gives the plant its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pale blue and white, typically blooming in late spring. It is native to a limited geographic region and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
